Test Name: Prenatal Aneuploidy Detection via Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization (FISH)
Specimen Type: Amniotic fluid, chorionic villus tissue, or fetal blood
Purpose: To detect common prenatal chromosomal aneuploidies (chromosomes 13, 18, 21, X, Y) in interphase nuclei.
Container: Sterile container for amniotic fluid or CVS tissue; heparinized syringe for fetal blood
Equipment: Fluorescence microscope with appropriate filter sets and chromosome-specific FISH probe sets
